title: Sights and sounds from the second round of the 2025 Open Championship
content: It's a close race at Royal Portrush. Follow along with the second round of the 2025 Open Championship.

title: Ex-NFLPA boss' strip club expenses face scrutiny
content: Former NFL Players Association leader Lloyd Howell Jr. resigned after an outside investigator hired by the union received documents this week showing he charged the union for two visits to strip clubs.

title: Guardians SP's leave pushed amid betting probe
content: Guardians pitcher Luis Ortiz will remain on non-disciplinary paid leave through Aug. 31, while an MLB investigation continues into unusual betting detected on individual pitches thrown by the starter.

title: Police: Noose found at Titans' new stadium site
content: A noose was found at the site of the Titans' new Nissan Stadium, according to the Metropolitan Nashville Police Department, with work stopped at the site amid an investigation.

title: DeChambeau fights back, improves by 13 shots
content: Bryson DeChambeau improved his score by 13 strokes and shot one of the low rounds of the day -- a 6-under 65 -- to jump back up to 1 over and be near the projected cut line.

title: Mo'ne Davis to try out for women's pro baseball
content: Former Little League phenom Mo'ne Davis will be one of more than 600 players to try out for the Women's Professional Baseball League set to launch next year.

title: Safely into weekend, Rory eyes big Open chase
content: Rory McIlroy carded a 2-under 69 in the second round of The Open to give him back-to-back under-par rounds and, most importantly, a tee time on the weekend.

title: Goalie Halak retires from NHL after 17 seasons
content: Goaltender Jaroslav Halak officially announced his retirement from the NHL after 17 seasons Friday, more than two years removed from his last game.

title: Chargers WR Williams retires, ends 8-year career
content: Chargers wide receiver Mike Williams is retiring from the NFL after eight seasons, with a source saying the decision surprised the team.

title: WNBA players, coaches voice frustration over how games are called
content: Players, coaches and fans say they want greater consistency regarding how games are refereed and the level of physicality allowed.

title: Sources: Man Utd, Brentford agree Mbeumo deal
content: Manchester United are set to complete the signing of Bryan Mbeumo after agreeing a deal in excess of £70 million ($94m) with Brentford, sources have told ESPN.

title: Madueke joins Arsenal from rivals Chelsea
content: Arsenal have completed the signing of Noni Madueke from London rivals Chelsea, the clubs confirmed Friday.

title: Masche on Messi, All-Stars: 'Would prefer rest'
content: Inter Miami head coach Javier Mascherano said he would prefer that Lionel Messi and Jordi Alba not participate in the 2025 MLS All-Star Game, insisting players should be resting amid the ongoing regular season.

title: Barça delay Camp Nou return amid permit issues
content: Barcelona's planned return to Spotify Camp Nou next month was again delayed, the club announced on Friday.

title: Dempsey: USMNT must win friendlies to sway fans
content: Clint Dempsey said success on the field during friendlies over the next year would help the U.S. fill seats with fans from their own country at the World Cup next year.

title: New Spurs boss Frank jokes: 'I wanted more risk'
content: Thomas Frank has joked he left Brentford for Tottenham because he wanted "more risk" -- but insisted he will be given time to turn the club into serial trophy challengers.

title: Marta 'saddened' by conditions at Copa América
content: Brazilian players, including six-time FIFA Player of the Year Marta, have criticised CONMEBOL and the organisers of the Women's Copa América in Ecuador for requiring teams to warm up in confined indoor areas rather than on the pitch.

title: Mourinho eyes Portugal return in 'height of career'
content: Jose Mourinho has declared his desire to return to coach in his native Portugal while he is still "at the height of his career."

title: How Bo Jackson on a bicycle united Alabama after a record-breaking storm
content: The GOAT created a bike ride to help tornado-damaged Alabama. No one knew what it'd do -- or how it'd end.

content: Moving the draft to All-Star week was supposed to give it some sizzle. But not one player was in attendance.

title: Suspended IFoS officer offers apology; Minister orders his suspension to be revoked
content: MoEFF is learnt to have communicated that the official’s suspension cannot be considered at this stage due to a ‘technical reason’

title: Chaitanya Baghel actively linked to proceeds of crime in liquor case: ED tells court
content: Probe agency tells PMLA court that Laxmi Narayan Bansal, another co-accused, had admitted that he handled more than ₹1,000 crore cash originating out of the liquor scam in association with Mr. Chaitanya Baghel, which are proceeds of crime

title: India does not subscribe to any unilateral measures, government says on EU sanctions
content: The European Union has announced a new package of sanctions aimed at Russia over its war against Ukraine. It also named Gujarat-based Nayara Energy’s Vadinar Refinery in which Russian energy firm Rosneft has a major stake.

title: Prashant Kishor leaves rally in a huff in Bihar, party says he suffered injury
content: According to a leader of the Jan Suraaj party, Mr. Kishor drove back to his Patna residence after receiving first aid locally.

title: Madras HC refuses to quash prosecution initiated by ECI against K.C. Veeramani for filing false affidavit
content: Justice P. Velmurugan dismisses the quash petition after ECI says, the former Minister had suppressed properties acquired abroad and also given false PAN numbers in his election affidavit

title: Six Maoists killed in encounter with security forces in Chhattisgarh’s Narayanpur
content: A gunfight broke out in the afternoon in the forest of Abujhmad region when joint teams of security forces were out on an operation, says Inspector General of Police (Bastar Range) P. Sundarraj

title: The Resistance Front was floated to deflect international sanctions against Pakistan: security officials
content: The Resistance Front has carried out terror attacks in Jammu & Kashmir’s Keran, Handwara, Sopore, Shopian, Anantnag, and Reasi with the latest one in Baisaran meadows of Pahalgam on April 22

title: Fundamental lack of ideological coherence in the INDIA bloc led to its limited success: CPI draft resolution
content: Ahead of the party’s 25th Congress general secretary D. Raja released the draft political resolution

title: Narendra Modi’s Bihar visit was an empty bundle: Manoj Kumar Jha
content: Without naming anyone, Mr. Jha alleged that the government in Bihar is running from Delhi Durbar and those who were supposed to run Bihar are not even able to run their own house.

title: 94.68% of Bihar voters covered in electoral roll revision drive, says Election Commission
content: With just 7 days left for collection of forms, the ECI has begun sharing the list of forms that could not be collected with political parties

title: Six migrant workers from Bengal arrested in Punjab under cow slaughter law
content: Detentions come amid wider concerns over treatment of West Bengal migrants across States; Welfare Board steps in for legal aid

title: 9 sentenced to life in prison in Bengal for digital arrest scam
content: Victim lost ₹1 crore and was digitally arrested for almost seven days; convicts are part of a gang which defrauded over ₹100 crore from 108 people across India

title: Maharashtra clears proposal to rename Islampur as Ishwarpur
content: The renaming of Islampur to Ishwarpur is the latest in a series of name changes undertaken by the Maharashtra government; in recent years, the State has renamed Aurangabad to Chhatrapati Sambhajinagar and Osmanabad to Dharashiv, with the Centre’s approval

title: RSS-affiliated farmers’ body calls for cancellation of permission to test GM maize at Punjab Agricultural University
content: Raising serious objections to the plan, a delegation headed by BKS Punjab chief Ravinder Singh Dhillon submitted a memorandum to the Vice Chancellor of Punjab Agricultural University

title: Bihar Cabinet gives nod to provide 125 units of free electricity to 1.67 crore power consumers
content: No fixed charge or other charges to be levied on those consuming up to 125 units; consumers using above 125 units will continue to get subsidised rate

title: BMRCL employees’ union oppose plan to outsource metro train pilots and operations staff
content: However, a senior BMRCL official clarified that the outsourcing decision has been taken primarily to address the current shortage of trained staff.

title: Centre creates fake ‘Supreme Court of Karnataka’ account to demonstrate ease of social media misuse
content: Solicitor General shows verified X handle to High Court; X Corp. calls move improper, says account now suspended

title: Police intensify search for District Congress Committee  member accused in land grab case in Thiruvananthapuram
content: Ananthapuri Manikandan, a vendor, is suspected to have masterminded a fraudulent property transfer at Kowdiar

title: Now, FIR can be registered in any police station in Tamil Nadu even for crimes outside jurisdiction
content: Such FIRs must be transferred electronically and physically to the competent police station within 24 hours

title: AAP no longer part of INDIA bloc: Party MP Sanjay Singh
content: AAP distances itself from INDIA bloc, questioning Congress’ leadership and emphasising strong Opposition role in upcoming Parliament session

title: This Kochi youngster handmade a Lamborghini Huracan LP 610-4 from scratch
content: Bibin Chacko spent three years fabricating a scaled down Lamborghini Huracan, which he had only seen before in pictures

title: Lack of fast-track courts to try cases of violence against women an issue: expert
content: Workshop on ‘Strengthening institutional mechanisms combating violence against women and girls’ held

title: Waiver wire: Start the second half strong with these pickups
content: As the season's second half gets ready to begin, here are the players you should claim off the waiver wire.

title: 'Rudy' or 'Hoosiers'? Indiana fan poll highlights SportsCenter's 50-in-50 Week 4 quiz
content: "SportsCenter" is continuing its journey across America -- and we're continuing to test your state-specific sports knowledge with our Week 4 quiz.

title: After U.S. labels The Resistance Front as global terror outfit, China calls for stronger regional anti-terror cooperation
content: “China calls on regional countries to enhance counterterrorism cooperation and jointly maintain regional security and stability,” Foreign Ministry spokesperson Lin Jian said

title: Andhra Pradesh hosts first South India regional conference on social audit
content: Andhra Pradesh Panchayat Raj Principal Secretary Shashibhushan Kumar highlights the State’s landmark initiative of livestreaming mandal-level public audits on YouTube, making it the first State in the country to do so

title: Local body polls: State Election Commission to hold meeting of political parties on Saturday
content: State Delimitation Commission is hoping to wind up the delimitation process by the middle of August. Launched last year, the mammoth exercise is in the third and final phase, where the wards of the district panchayats are being reorganised

title: Right-wing group storms Ghaziabad eateries over sale of meat during Sawan
content: Congress, Samajwadi Party term incident a violation of citizens’ rights; question inaction by authorities

title: T.N. government establishes Chennai Institute of Journalism
content: It will offer a postgraduate diploma programme in journalism from the 2025-26 academic year. Notification for admission will be issued soon

title: Quantum Valley initiative will change the face of Andhra Pradesh, says Vijayawada MP
content: The government is not only focused on job creation but also on promoting entrepreneurship through the Society for Employment and Entrepreneurship Development in Andhra Pradesh: Kesineni Sivanath

title: National seminar on diversity of traditional knowledge systems to be held
content: KSHEC governing body meeting held. Meeting decides to expedite transition of remaining universities to K-REAP software system

title: Raise important issues in Parliament, mobilise maximum funds from  Centre, Naidu tells TDP MPs
content: He wants them to focus on Minimum Support Price for various crops, utilisation of the Godavari and Krishna river waters and the support required by A.P. for industrial development

title: Jagan is trying to create panic among investors, alleges A.P. I&PR Minister Parthasarathy
content: The YSRCP president has neither administrative skills nor concern for the future of the State, as his political approach is solely for personal gain, he alleges

title: $15 billion to be invested on transformative infrastructure in Telangana, says Minister for IT
content: The focus will not just be on scale, but on balanced growth too, one ensuring development beyond Hyderabad, in Tier-2 and Tier-3 cities, through strategic investments in infrastructure, talent and connectivity, the Minister said

title: DMK government is a failed model, says Palaniswami
content: The former Chief Minister accuses the State government of allowing law and order to deteriorate and of failing to ensure the safety and security of women

title: Waste from Thiruvananthapuram city being dumped in nearby panchayats despite tracking mechanism by Corporation
content: A person attached to one of the agencies contracted by the civic body to transport waste to processing centres in Ernakulam arrested for allegedly dumping waste in Aruvikkara

title: Balasore student death: Letter by classmates seeking deceased college girl’s rustication emerges in Odisha
content: Brother of deceased has alleged that signature campaign was orchestrated by the accused teacher in order to influence the investigation

title: Maharashtra Council extends deadline for Privileges Committee report on Kunal Kamra, Sushma Andhare
content: The stand-up comedian and Shiv Sena (UBT) spokesperson under scrutiny over remarks directed at the State Deputy Chief Minister Eknath Shinde

title: Applications invited from Intermediate pass students for Central scholarship scheme
content: Eligible students from 2025 batch can apply online by October 10; renewals accepted till October 31, says BIE Secretary Kritika Shukla

title: Patna murder: Footage shows gunmen celebrating on street after mafia-style ICU hitjob - Watch
content: Following the brazen daylight execution of a murder convict inside Patna's Paras Hospital, new footage has emerged showing the suspected killers celebrating their act openly on the streets, brandishing a firearm. The incident, captured on CCTV, has ignited outrage over Bihar's deteriorating law and order situation, prompting political accusations and demands for stricter governance.

title: Bihar elections: Is BJP using Chirag Paswan to checkmate CM Nitish?
content: Chirag Paswan is again targeting Bihar CM Nitish Kumar, this time over the state's deteriorating law and order, raising concerns about rising crime. Despite being part of the NDA, Paswan's criticism mirrors opposition claims, fueling speculation of a repeat of his 2020 strategy, when he supported the BJP but opposed Nitish Kumar.

title: Odisha's self-immolation case: Victim's friend says HoD threatened to fail her
content: In Balasore, a B.Ed student's self-immolation case has taken a turn as her friend alleges the HoD threatened to fail her for not complying with demands. The friend also accused the Principal of provoking the victim, leading to her tragic death after a protest against the HoD.

title: 'Quite a feat' - FIDE CEO lauds Indians after all four enter QFs of women's WC
content: In a first, Koneru Humpy, Dronavalli Harika, R Vaishali, and Divya Deshmukh made it to the FIDE Women’s World Cup quarterfinals. FIDE CEO Emil Sutovsky congratulated the players. The Indian players won tense tie-breakers. Humpy defeated Alexandra Kosteniuk, and Harika edged out Kateryna Lagno. Vaishali defeated Meruert Kamalidenova, and Divya Deshmukh beat Zhu Jiner.

title: Coldplay concert viral video: Astronomer CEO caught on kiss cam; Musk reacts
content: A video of Astronomer CEO Andy Byron and HR head Kristin Cabot kissing at a Coldplay concert has gone viral, sparking online chatter dubbed "Coldplaygate." The incident, captured on a kiss cam, led to speculation about workplace relationships. Elon Musk reacted to a morphed apology tweet with a laughing emoji, further fueling the controversy.

title: 'Dubo ke maarenge': Raj Thackeray counters BJP MP's 'patak ke maarenge' remark
content: MNS chief Raj Thackeray retaliated against BJP MP Nishikant Dubey's threatening remark, daring him to visit Mumbai, escalating the language debate in Maharashtra. Thackeray warned of retaliation in Mumbai's waters, responding to Dubey's defense that Mumbai isn't exclusively for Marathis.

title: Sachs has plan to keep junior talent; Memo says: will introduce early ...
content: Goldman Sachs is launching a new program to retain junior bankers amid increasing competition from private equity firms. The initiative offers select analysts an accelerated path to the Asset & Wealth Management (AWM) division after two years in investment banking. This strategy aims to provide an 'early entry point' for those interested in buyside careers.

title: Dhangri massacre: NIA court frames charges against 2 terrorist harbourers
content: A special NIA court in Jammu has charged Nisar Ahmed and Mushtaq Hussain for aiding the 2023 Dhangri massacre perpetrators. Accused of providing shelter, food, and guidance to terrorists linked to Lashkar-e-Taiba, they face charges under IPC, UAPA, and Juvenile Justice Act. Both pleaded not guilty and sought trial after being accused of facilitating the attack that killed five villagers.

title: Sonya Curry shares heartfelt message, visits mother in hospital
content: Sonya Curry, mother of Stephen Curry, recently shared an emotional message on Instagram. She urged her followers to connect with their loved ones. Sonya emphasized the importance of spending quality time with family and friends. She encouraged fans to make an effort to visit and engage with people they care about. Sonya also launched a 'LOVE FIERCELY' challenge.

title: Thief posing as soldier kills soon-to-be groom in Srinagar
content: In Qazigund, Srinagar, a man posing as a soldier entered a house under the guise of a search operation. When a family member grew suspicious and confronted him, the imposter stabbed him to death. The accused, Naseer Ahmad Sheikh, has been arrested, and an investigation is underway to uncover the full details of the crime and any potential accomplices.

title: Perplexity CEO says Google ‘a giant bureaucratic organization’
content: Perplexity's CEO, Aravind Srinivas, challenges Google's reliance on ads. He believes it hinders AI integration. Srinivas anticipates Google will adopt features from Perplexity's Comet browser. He also criticizes Google's organizational structure. Comet, an AI-powered browser, prioritizes users. It is currently available to premium Perplexity subscribers. A free version is planned. Srinivas aims to challenge Google's market dominance.

title: Every city must have chief information security officer, says home secretary
content: Union Home Secretary Govind Mohan emphasized the necessity for every city to appoint a Chief Information Security Officer (CISO) to safeguard data and systems against cyber threats. He urged states and city administrations to conduct regular security audits and build internal capacity for technology integration.

title: Road ministry to rank states on land buy speed to fast-track NH projects
content: The road transport ministry will soon rank states based on their 'ease of land acquisition' for national highway projects, addressing a major cause of delays. This initiative aims to prioritize projects in states that efficiently provide land, potentially using past performance as a benchmark. The Centre's reliance on state governments for land acquisition underscores the importance of this ranking system.

title: IND vs ENG: Karun Nair lambasted after his poor displays in England - 'Beautiful 30 is not expected from a No. 3'
content: Farokh Engineer has voiced concerns about Karun Nair's form in the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy, citing his inability to convert starts into significant scores. With Nair averaging just 21.83, pressure mounts ahead of the Manchester Test. Engineer emphasized the need for substantial runs from the No. 3 position.

title: Courtroom chaos erupts, Sharpe accuser’s lawyer blamed; secret postponement deal sparks outrage
content: The Shannon Sharpe sexual assault case saw a twist. The accuser's legal team missed a court date in Las Vegas. Attorney Tony Buzbee cited a mutual agreement for postponement. Judge Albertson expressed disappointment. Sharpe's attorney sought an extension. The next hearing is in September. Sharpe denies the charges. He calls it blackmail. The case involves public accusations and counter-accusations.

title: Luka Doncic exit buzz rises, Lakers’ LeBron treatment questioned; future hangs in the balance
content: Luka Doncic's future with the Los Angeles Lakers is uncertain as he approaches a player option in 2025-26. Tension arises from the Lakers' apparent shift towards prioritizing Doncic over LeBron James, potentially alienating the Slovenian star. Concerns grow that the Lakers' treatment of James could impact Doncic's trust and willingness to commit long-term.

title: Mariners mock Astronomer CEO as viral video sparks affair rumours
content: Following a viral Kiss Cam moment at a Coldplay concert, Astronomer's CEO, Andy Byron, and Chief of Human Resources, Kristin Cabot, were caught in a compromising position, sparking affair rumors. The Seattle Mariners then playfully capitalized on the situation with a meme featuring Cal Raleigh, inviting those in similar situations to contact them, further fueling the internet frenzy.

title: Debt, shame, vanishing dreams: Why millions in China feel trapped - and alone
content: China's economic growth masks a debt crisis. Many citizens face financial strain. They struggle with job insecurity and wage cuts. Some turn to side hustles for survival. A few share their debt stories online. The government offers subsidies. However, consumer sentiment remains low. Structural reforms are slow. The Chinese dream faces challenges. People prioritize survival over spending.

title: 'It was not ...': India batter responds to shoulder contact controversy after ICC fine
content: Indian batter Pratika Rawal addressed the controversy surrounding her shoulder contact with England players during the first Women's ODI, stating it was unintentional. The ICC fined her 10 percent of her match fee and issued one demerit point.

title: Coldplay ‘kiss cam’ scandal: Who is Andy Byron’s wife Megan Kerrigan?
content: Astronomer CEO Andy Byron's public embrace with his Chief People Officer at a Coldplay concert ignited a scandal, raising questions about workplace ethics and his marriage. Byron's wife, Megan Kerrigan, responded by removing his surname from social media, hinting at marital strain. The incident sparked widespread online reactions, with many supporting Kerrigan amidst affair rumors.

title: How conman duped big shots; Rs 2.75 cr ring, luxury liquor seized
content: Mangaluru police apprehended Roshan Saldana, accused of swindling crores from businessmen by posing as a wealthy entrepreneur. Saldana promised large loans, collected stamp duty and commissions, and then defrauded his victims. Police seized incriminating documents, jewelry, and excessive liquor from his residence, also revealing ₹40 crore in transactions over recent months.

title: 'Majboori hai': MP claims BJP may not win even 150 seats without PM Modi
content: BJP MP Nishikant Dubey emphasized PM Modi's crucial role in the party's electoral triumphs, asserting that without PM Modi's leadership, the BJP might struggle to secure even 150 seats. He highlighted how PM Modi's popularity has drawn in previously unsupportive voter segments, particularly among the poor.

title: For Brian Lara, Jasprit Bumrah is the 'GOAT'! Rohit Sharma is...
content: Brian Lara has unveiled his 'Greatest of All Time' selections, featuring Jasprit Bumrah alongside legends like Glenn McGrath, Jacques Kallis, and Adam Gilchrist. He also named Rohit Sharma, Chris Gayle, Shaheen Shah Afridi, Kane Williamson, and Kevin Pietersen in his 'legend' category.

title: IND vs ENG: Rohit's WTC record in danger! Pant closes in on massive feat
content: India faces England in the crucial fourth Test at Old Trafford, seeking to level the series after their Lord's defeat. Rishabh Pant, cleared to play despite a finger injury, is close to surpassing Rohit Sharma's WTC run record for India, needing just 40 runs. India's hopes hinge on Pant's performance as they aim to keep the series alive.

title: Trump questions why Dems didn't release Epstein files if it is 'smoking gun''
content: Donald Trump has questioned why Democrats didn't disclose Jeffrey Epstein-related files during their control of the Senate and White House, suggesting they had no incriminating evidence. This statement followed his instruction to Attorney General Pam Bondi to release relevant grand jury testimony in the Epstein case, amid pressure from both supporters and Democrats.

title: US universities could see 70% drop in Indian students this fall- here's why
content: American universities anticipate a significant drop in Indian students this fall due to visa appointment freezes and increased rejection rates. Students are facing uncertainty and exploring alternative countries like Germany as visa slots remain scarce. The US Consulate General in Hyderabad assures that slots have resumed, but heightened scrutiny is causing anxiety and application withdrawals.

title: 'Why attack Hindi speakers?' Nishikant defends 'patak ke marenge' remarks
content: Nishikant Dubey defended his controversial "tumko patak patak ke marenge" remark, asserting that Mumbai belongs to all, not just Marathi speakers. He criticized the targeting of Hindi speakers and questioned the selective outrage, pointing out the diverse linguistic makeup of Mumbai. Dubey warned Uddhav and Raj Thackeray that they would face consequences outside Maharashtra for their divisive actions.

title: Exclusive | Divyanshi, first Indian in 36 years to win historic gold, 'really scared' of a school challenge
content: Divyanshi Bhowmick, a 14-year-old table tennis prodigy, recently made history by winning the U-15 girls’ singles crown at the Asian Youth Table Tennis Championships after 36 years. Despite her remarkable achievements and world ranking, she faces a different kind of challenge: the upcoming Class 10 board exams. She is 'really scared' of it.

title: Why new Superman movie isn't 'anti-Israel'
content: The Extrapolation Bias: A meta-bias where one’s brain takes one bit of data and decides to use it explain everything. It’s the Captain Planet of cognitive distortions – summoned when Confirmation Bias, Availability Heuristic, the Baader-Meinhof Effect, Illusory Correlation and Narrative Bias join forces. It’s the mind’s lazy cognitive shortcut where one instance becomes an example of a pattern and ergo proof of how society is functioning. You're not analysing — you're projecting, pattern-hunting, and storytelling your way into a worldview that feels right, even if it has no resemblance to reality.

title: Oilers eye $27M Marchessault — veteran scoring boost targeted
content: The Edmonton Oilers are reportedly exploring a major trade move this offseason. NHL insiders link them to Nashville Predators forward Jonathan Marchessault, who carries a $27.5 million deal. With Stanley Cup pressure building and a need for top-six scoring, Edmonton could see Marchessault as a high-risk, high-reward acquisition, if contract hurdles and fit can be managed.

title: IND vs ENG: After Sachin, Gavaskar and Dravid, KL Rahul 11 runs away from...
content: KL Rahul is close to joining an elite group of Indian cricketers, needing just 11 more runs to reach 1,000 Test runs in England. He aims to achieve this milestone in the upcoming fourth Test against England in Manchester.

title: Reliance Industries posts net profit of Rs 26,994 crore; up 78% YOY
content: RIL Q1 results FY 2025-26: Mukesh Ambani-led Reliance Industries posted a Profit After Tax (PAT) of Rs 26,994 crore beating Street estimates. The net profit rose 78% from Rs 15,138 crore a year ago.

title: 'TMC facilitates infiltrators': PM Modi slams Mamata govt- Top quotes
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi criticized the Trinamool Congress (TMC) in Durgapur, accusing them of jeopardizing West Bengal's identity by encouraging infiltration, which he views as a threat to both the state and the nation. He pledged action against illegal immigrants while highlighting the BJP's commitment to Bengali pride and development. Modi also inaugurated development projects worth ₹5,400 crore.

title: Read: Top 5 entertainment news
content: Khushi Kapoor shared her views on cosmetic surgery. Aamir Khan spoke about his bond with his ex-wives, Reena Dutta and Kiran Rao. Mohit Suri recalled approaching Amrita Singh for a role. Kiara Advani and Sidharth Malhotra took their newborn home. A viral statement followed a Coldplay concert involving Astronomer CEO Andy Byron. The statement was later confirmed to be fake.

title: Watch | FIR filed against Shami's estranged wife; video of scuffle goes viral
content: Hasin Jahan, the estranged wife of Mohammed Shami, and her daughter Arshi Jahan are facing serious charges, including attempted murder, after a violent clash with a neighbour, Dalia Khatoon, in Suri, West Bengal. The dispute arose over a contested plot of land, leading to a physical altercation that resulted in Dalia's hospitalisation and a police investigation following the viral video.

title: How 5 shooters dodged checkpoints at Patna hospital, killed gangster in 30 seconds
content: The daylight murder of gangster Chandan Mishra within Patna's Paras HMRI, while on parole for medical treatment, has triggered a major security review. Five unmasked assailants executed the crime swiftly, raising concerns about potential security lapses and staff involvement. Authorities are investigating how the armed attackers bypassed checkpoints, with suspicion falling on possible reconnaissance and internal collusion.

title: IND vs ENG: When will India begin preparations in Manchester for 4th Test?
content: Following a narrow defeat at Lord's, Shubman Gill and the Indian team have arrived in Manchester for a crucial fourth Test against England, starting July 23. With England leading the series 2-1, India faces a must-win situation. Preparations include optional and full training sessions, with media interactions scheduled to address the pressure and strategies for a comeback.

title: Air India crash: Tata Group launches Rs 500 crore trust for victims’ families
content: Following the Air India Flight AI-171 crash in Ahmedabad, Tata Group has established 'The AI-171 Memorial and Welfare Trust' with a corpus of Rs 500 crore. The trust aims to support the victims' families and those affected by the tragedy.

title: Trump targets Fed Chair again, calls on 'too late, numbskull’ to lower rates
content: Donald Trump has escalated his criticism of Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell, accusing him of stalling the housing market with high interest rates. Trump hinted at a possible dismissal over a controversial $2.5 billion renovation at the Fed's headquarters, branding Powell a "numbskull.

title: With 5,000 Government Cases Pending, Delhi Pushes For Litigation Overhaul
content: Chief Minister Rekha Gupta on Friday flagged the surging number of pending court cases involving the government and called for a complete revamp of how litigation is handled, in a move aimed at clearing the city's mounting legal clutter.

title: Kremlin Says Trump Ukraine Pressure Wont End US-Russia Talks
content: Kremlin said on Friday that it did not believe that a tougher stance US President Donald Trump has adopted towards Russia over its war in Ukraine means the end of US-Russia talks aimed at reviving their battered ties.

title: Congress Protest March In Srinagar Tomorrow Over J&K Statehood
content: After its letter to Prime Minister Narendra Modi, the Congress party is launching a campaign to put pressure on the central government to introduce a bill in the upcoming Parliament session for the restoration of statehood for Jammu and Kashmir.

title: Jagan Reddy Party MP Likely To Surrender Tomorrow In Andhra Liquor 'Scam'
content: YSR Congress MP PV Midhun Reddy is expected to surrender before the Special Investigation Team (SIT) on Saturday morning in connection with the alleged multi-crore Andhra Pradesh liquor scam.

title: "Yeh Andar Ki Baat Hai": Uddhav Thackeray On D Fadnavis' 'Offer'
content: Uddhav Thackeray has responded to an 'offer' by Maharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis that has sparked huge speculation.

title: University Expels Bangladeshi Student Over Clash On Serving Non-Veg Food On Shivratri
content: A Bangladeshi scholar was expelled from the South Asian University and a fine of Rs. 5000 was imposed on the students' mess secretary for serving non-vegetarian food on Maha Shivratri, officials said on Friday.

title: Humanitarian Funding Cuts Put 11 Million Refugees At Risk: UN
content: Massive cuts to humanitarian budgets risk leaving more than 11 million refugees without desperately needed aid, the United Nations warned Friday.

title: He Changed Colours Like Chameleon: Eknath Shinde On Uddhav Thackeray
content: Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Eknath Shinde on Friday hit out at Shiv Sena (UBT) chief Uddhav Thackeray, accusing him of betraying his ally Devendra Fadnavis in 2019.

title: Will "Shut Down" Maharashtra Schools If Hindi Imposed From Class 1: Raj Thackeray
content: Maharashtra Navnirman Sena chief Raj Thackeray on Friday said if Hindi was made mandatory for Classes 1 to 5 in schools in Maharashtra, his party will "shut down schools".

title: Spending Over Rs 5,000? Take Permission From Boss: Uttarakhand's Bizarre Order
content: Buying clothes for your spouse, a smartphone for yourself or even an expensive mixer grinder? If you are an Uttarakhand government employee, you will now have to not just inform your boss, but even take clearance from him.

title: Delhi Man Dies Of Electrocution, Wife, Lover Suspected Of Murder: Cops
content: A 36-year-old man was electrocuted in Delhi's Dwarka, with police suspect that the incident was orchestrated by his wife and her partner, an official said on Friday.

title: Why Netanyahu Government Is On The Verge Of Collapse And How He Can Save It
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's government is on the brink of collapse. Israel's two ultra-Orthodox parties - United Torah Judaism (UTJ) and Shas - have announced plans to leave Netanyahu's coalition.

title: Union Ministers Hold Strategy Meet Ahead Of Parliament Monsoon Session
content: Several Union ministers, including Rajnath Singh, Amit Shah, J P Nadda and Kiren Rijiju, held a strategy session at the defence minister's residence here on Thursday ahead of Parliament's Monsoon Session beginning from July 21.

title: "Average Lawyer": Kiren Rijiju Attacks Kapil Sibal Over Cash-At-Home Row
content: Dismissing Kapil Sibal as an "average lawyer", Parliamentary Affairs Minister Kiren Rijiju on Friday said Parliament cannot be dictated by one MP's "personal agenda".

title: Fake Call Centre Scammed Foreigners, Busted. Assets Attached By Enforcement Directorate
content: The Patna zonal office of the Enforcement Directorate (ED) has provisionally attached movable and immovable properties worth approximately Rs 2.83 crore under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA), 2002.

title: Trinamool On Streets To Protect Infiltrators: PM's Attack On Mamata Banerjee
content: PM Narendra Modi on Friday tore into the Trinamool Congress, accusing it of risking Bengal's identity and national security by promoting infiltration for vote-bank politics, and asserted that only the BJP genuinely stands for Bengali 'asmita'.

title: What China Said On US Move Against Terror Group Behind Pahalgam Attack
content: China on Friday called on regional countries to enhance counter terrorism cooperation to safeguard regional security, in a guarded reaction to the US designating The Resistance Front, a proxy of Pakistan-based Lashkar-e-Tayyiba (LeT), as a foreign te

title: Tata Group Sets Up Rs 500 Crore Welfare Trust For Air India Plane Crash Victims
content: Tata Sons and Tata Trusts on Friday said they have set up a Rs 500 crore welfare trust for the victims of the Air India plane crash.

title: Trump Gets Approval For $9 billion Cut To Public Broadcasting, Foreign Aid
content: The House gave final approval to President Donald Trump's request to claw back about $9 billion for public broadcasting and foreign aid

title: Second half sees Ceddanne Rafaela at second base?
content: fantasy baseball buzz file aims to provide fantasy managers with the intel they need as news breaks around MLB . a mild 71 degrees with wind blowing slightly in could help keep a pair of potent lineups in check . the only game in jeopardy is the Washington Nationals hosting the San Diego Padres .

title: Our latest intel on MLB trade deadline rumors, Tucker's free agency and more
content: the baseball world gathered in Atlanta for the 2025 MLB draft , home run Derby and all-star game this week . our reporters were there talking to execs, coaches, agents, scouts, players and other team sources .

title: If the College Football Playoff isn't broken, why fix it?
content: college football's opposition to an expanded, let alone expansive, playoff is dead and buried . the 81-year-old retired just this week after a second stint leading west Virginia University . plans to move from 12 participants to 16 were underway before last season's inaugural 12-teamer even took place .

title: Dear 'Diamond': Letters to Dustin Poirier on the eve of his final UFC fight
content: Dustin Poirier will make his final walk to the UFC Octagon against Max Holloway . the 36-year-old says he has decided to walk away to preserve his long-term health . poirier is considered one of the top lightweights in the world, ranked no. 5 in ESPN's divisional rankings .

title: Joel Embiid sees you
content: Kendrick Perkins: Embiid feels pressured to play through injury showcases trust issues . he says he's leaning back on a couch that seemed spacious until he eased his long body onto it . his son, Arthur, peeks around corners from the hallway to see what we're up to .

title: What we're hearing in the transfer window: Sancho, Rashford headed to Juve?
content: the transfer window is open across Europe, and business is starting to get done . sportsmail's reporters hear about possible deals every Friday until September . it's highly unlikely that Juventus will get both players, for a number of reasons .
